reviews.review_msg: I think professor McNeney did a fairly good job with this course. The class was well organized and he teaches the concepts well enough. I found the way he explained some concepts to be confusing, especially concerning the MARS algorithm for our final project.

Brad is super caring and very helpful. The class was difficult for those who don't have a programming background, and the group project required a ton of work. However, Brad will help you always if you are willing to ask questions and come to his office hours. In the end, I learned a lot!

Dr. Shi is a very good instructor. He gave clear instructions to you to work on the project. If you attend all tutorials and start the project 3 weeks before the due. You will finish the project smoothly. The project is slightly challenging but it helps you to understand how R package works. The difficulty is reasonable for a 300-level course.
Haolun has the potential to become the best professor. Very Kind and Understanding.

This coding class isn't easy, but the projects are challenging and rewarding. Professor Shi is an exceptional teacher. He teaches with clarity and dedication, making complex topics understandable. He's truly a professor not to be missed!

What I learned is course has nothing to do with my term project. If difficulty for STAT260 is level 1, then for STAT360 would be 100+. The gap between these two courses are like CMPT120 compare to CMPT125. The exams are open book open laptop(without GPT). But for the 40% project, it suffers me for weeks. Avoid it if you are not good at programming.
